docs.snippet: THURSDAY will start a long week-end for persons able to expand the Thanksgiving holiday to a four-day vacation. Advance reservations indicate that trains and buses leaving and entering New York, especially on Wednesday and Sunday. will carry heavy...
docs.lead_paragraph: THURSDAY will start a long week-end for persons able to expand the Thanksgiving holiday to a four-day vacation. Advance reservations indicate that trains and buses leaving and entering New York, especially on Wednesday and Sunday. will carry heavy loads.

headline.main: NEWS NOTES FROM THE FIELD OF TRAVEL

docs.snippet: WHITE PLAINS, N. Y., Nov. 21 -- Twenty Latin-American countries presented national flags here today to the Archbishop Stepinac Roman Catholic High School for Boys. Consuls General of the countries delivered the gifts and joined with church and school...
docs.lead_paragraph: WHITE PLAINS, N. Y., Nov. 21 -- Twenty Latin-American countries presented national flags here today to the Archbishop Stepinac Roman Catholic High School for Boys. Consuls General of the countries delivered the gifts and joined with church and school leaders in pledges of hemispheric friendship, understanding and peace.
docs.abstract: Hemisphere solidarity stressed as flags of 20 nations are presented to Abp Stepinac HS, White Plains, NY

headline.main: SCHOOL GETS FLAGS OF LATIN AMERICA; Banners of 20 Nations Given to White Plains Institution Amid Pledges of Peace

docs.snippet: The plenary session of the United Nations General Assembly at Flushing Meadow adjourned almost an hour before schedule shortly after 1 P. M. yesterday when the delegates had to choose between their Thanksgiving Day dinners and listening to a debate...
docs.lead_paragraph: The plenary session of the United Nations General Assembly at Flushing Meadow adjourned almost an hour before schedule shortly after 1 P. M. yesterday when the delegates had to choose between their Thanksgiving Day dinners and listening to a debate on full employment.

docs.lead_paragraph: BOGOTA, Nov. 26 -- The whole Good-Neighbor Policy and the question of anti-democratic trends in the Western Hemisphere are inevitably involved in the present crisis in Colombia, where tomorrow, for the first time, a Presidential election will be held under martial law.

docs.snippet: Only one of the six points raised by Moore-McCormack Lines, Inc., in support of its application for resumption of an operating subsidy for its three "Good-Neighbor" passenger vessels, was approved by C. W. Robinson, Maritime Commission trail...
docs.lead_paragraph: Only one of the six points raised by Moore-McCormack Lines, Inc., in support of its application for resumption of an operating subsidy for its three "Good-Neighbor" passenger vessels, was approved by C. W. Robinson, Maritime Commission trail examiner, in his report to the commission. The report was made public here yesterday.
docs.abstract: comm examiner rept backs Moore-McCormack plea for subsidy on foreign competition basis, rejects plea on 5 other grounds; makes no recommendation; comm sets new hearing

headline.main: EXAMINER REPORTS ON SUBSIDY PLEA; Upholds Moore-McCormack on One Point Only, Competition by Foreign-Flag Ships

docs.snippet: LAKE SUCCESS; Nov. 29 -- The Soviet Union demanded this afternoon that the United Nations General Assembly go ahead with the plan for the international administration of the Jerusalem area contained in the Palestine partition resolution adopted two...
docs.lead_paragraph: LAKE SUCCESS; Nov. 29 -- The Soviet Union demanded this afternoon that the United Nations General Assembly go ahead with the plan for the international administration of the Jerusalem area contained in the Palestine partition resolution adopted two years ago today.
docs.abstract: S K Tsarapkin (USSR) urges UN com revert to '47 plan; blames US and GB for plan failure; offers amendments to Australian motion replacing UN Conciliation Comm work with proposed adm statute drafted by Trusteeship Council; policy reversal to gain Arab support seen; UN com forms subcom to map compromise; Min Eban (Israel) drops Sharet proposals for evacuation of Old City; agrees to direct UN adm of shrines
